reviews.sentence: Great stay with just a little room for improvement. There are a lot of good hotels in the downtown area that are great for exploring all the must see sites but we took advantage of SPG ’s Hot Escapes special and scored a rock bottom price that made the Sheraton Philadelphia Downtown the clear winner. Even so we feel it was a good value even at the normal price. We arrived late and the lobby was really busy but check in was quick and easy. The desk agent was friendly and greeted us promptly gave us the scoop on where to go for light night nibbles and even wished me a happy birthday. Since it was late we opted to eat in the lobby bar. There were a couple of convention meeting groups at the hotel so it was busy but we found a seat quickly. Service was a slow though. Despite the crowd there seemed to be a wait staff of one. After that we relaxed in the comfortable lobby sofas and took advantage of the free Wi Fi there. Our room was on the Club Level which we appreciated we missed the evening hors douevres but there was an espresso machine in the lounge that would become my best friend. We did have breakfast daily in the Club Lounge which could be done better. The options were limited to scrambled eggs oatmeal a few pastries and some fresh fruit. The espresso machine was good but time consuming having a pot of brewed coffee available would have helped. Our room was unremarkable in that it is a typical Sheraton room but comfortable and very clean and the television and furnishings were in good condition. The bed was comfy cozy with big fluffy pillows but looked hastily made. I have noticed a trend towards loosely made beds rather than tight corners and smooth bedspreads. I ca n’t say I ’m a big fan of this “ shabby chic ” approach to bedding. The desk was large and clutter free with outlets at the lamp and on the desktop itself. A comfortable chair ottoman and side table rounded out the room but the best feature was the view of a snow dusted Logan Square outside. Two things we found missing were an in room safe and refrigerator which would have been nice to have. But the closest we came to a complaint was in the shower once you switched from faucet to shower the water stream dwindled. It seemed that there was a lot of water pressure just not a lot of water coming from the shower head. The front desk was quick to send up extra supplies when we asked and the staff was super polite about everything. One amenity that we surely appreciated was free in room Wi Fi which was easy to connect to and reasonably fast. We did have trouble attempting to stream movies on a tablet but no problems streaming music on a phone or transferring files on a laptop so we are not so sure where the issue was. Free Wi Fi is not included in all room rates a policy we believe hotels everywhere should re examineOveral we enjoyed our stay. The staff was excellent and that far outweighed the few areas that could use improvement. In fact I would not even say there was a negative element just a little room to improve an already good experience.

In need of some freshening. I stayed here during a conference. Pleasant and spacious common areas. Expansive lobby. Nice staff. Banquet food was fine. But the hallways and rooms are slightly dark and dreary. The place needs some new wallpaper a lighting upgrade carpeting and a coat of paint. My room was comfortable but nothing special. Carpeting was not glued down there was a lump running the entire length of the room 735. The hotel is a short walk to center city and very close to the Franklin Institute and Barnes Foundation. Upon returning to Philadelphia I probably would not choose to stay here.

No character. We arrived around lunchtime on a Thursday with several bags only to be ignored by the doorman who laughed when I got stuck in the door with all of my bags not a good start. However we did arrive before check in and were given a room straight away. The room was fine nice comfortable bed clean but a very small bathroom. The concierge was lovely and extremely helpful with lots of tips on how to get around. The rest of the staff not so much. At one point I was made to feel like a criminal when I was followed across the lobby by some kind of security guard who looked ready to throw me out. as soon as I produced my room key he walked ofNice breakfast in the club lounge but could use a bit more variety and a good location.

Very nice comfortable hotel with EXCELLENT staff. The hotel was very nice comfortable in all of the ways that one would expect though I have stayed in other hotels that have failed to meet even minimal expectations. The room was clean very comfortable and quiet. My room was on the 23rd floor so I also had a fantastic view of the city. But mostly I would like to comment on the awesome service which was delivered by their amazing staff. Each and every staff member that I dealt with was super friendly and engaging but also very professional. Regardless of whether I was dressed in professional business attire or I was wearing my faded t shirt and jeans I was treated exactly the same they went over and beyond to meet all of my needs. For example upon check out I really needed to weigh my luggage because I was bringing home a number of heavy books and I thought that I was probably over the airlines 50 lb weight limit. I normally travel with my own luggage scale for just such occasions but I did not have it this time. I asked whether the hotel kept one handy for guests. The answer was No but let me see if I can find something somewhere that will get the job done. And that is exactly what he did. Then he spent 15 minutes or more helping figure out which items I needed to shift or remove from my suitcase so that I would not have carry more than was absolutely necessary. And the entire time he remained friendly and funny and never made me feel rushed. I found the entire staff to be similarly great.
Perfect. The hotel staff was very kind and courteous. The room was vey nice and spotless and had a great view and the bed was VERY comfortable.

Great distance to everything in Phily. Had a comfortable 3 night stay at this hotel in Phily. Only a few blocks from the Franklin Institution we were only 10 minutes cab ride away from the cool historic sites of Philadelphia The room was big enough for 3 people clean comfortable beds big bathroom however the shower pressure was weak. The breakfast buffet was boring no flavour but lunch was a bit better. All in all I would stay here again.

Add free wifi mini fridges and a coffee maker in the room and I would have given it 5 stars. We brought back leftovers from eating and bottled water for the weekend and there was no fridge. I could nt believe it I even looked in the bathroom because i ve never stayed in a hotel room with out one. I just do nt get it people eat out when they are on holiday u have to have refrigerators in the rooms and u got ta have coffee. The price was very reasonable the beds were comfy the view was lovely our room was clean and I really liked the windowed ceiling in the pool area.

A decent business hotel. This Sheraton seems to do a good business with the traveling professional and good for them. Comfortable spacious rooms decent bathroom I am not sure if I was in a renovated room or not. Well equipped fitness center with indoor pool and large windows. The biggest recommendation I could make would be to redecorate the bar area. it is this enormous cavernous area in an atrium with no character very slow service due to understafing and a poor selection of food in my opinion. All in all a good experience for a business trip. Nothing terribly wrong just wished my leisure time could have been in a nicer setting.

Affordable Convenient. I had a wkend birthday trip in Phily during Thanksgiving Holiday Weekend. Sheraton Philadelphia Downtown Hotel was nearby my event. It was convenient affordable. Very clean rooms comfortable beds. I felt I was sleeping in Cloud 9. Very upscale building w panoramic high rise views. I definitely had a great time using the swimming pool. I will definitely look up Sheraton Philadelphia Downtown Hotel again when I have my relatives birthday celebration in Philadelphia PA.
Nice hotel but could not get their phones working. Beautiful view of Ben Franklin Parkway and Museums. For the 24 hours we were there no phone service in the entire hotel. Unbelieveable.

Ranita was on point. Ranita the front desk attendant was very helpful after we made her aware of the stains on the sheets and the fact the TV were not working. The sheets were dirty the remote control did not work with the tv. Visual stains on the blankets.

Being at this hotel for a conference I was faced with a challenge which threw me off completely and permanently. I am a breastfeeding mom and while I was at the lobby meeting one of my colleagues my infant wanted to be fed. A quiet place that I was offered by the reception was a handicap bathroom. Thanks but no thanks. You do not have your lunch in a bathroom why should my baby eat there. I will not be staying in this hotel again.

What I disliked tremendously is that I was not able to get wifi in my room unles I paid. All travelers now a days assume that if you pay for a hotel room in 3 4 5 star hotel you get wifi. It is included in the price.

First when we got there and the room was not ready we had to wait nearly 2 hours to get our room. During our wait I checked with the front desk and they told me they did not have anyone even working on cleaning a room with a king size bed and they would see if they could get a house cleaner started on one keep in mind I had already waited an hour and half at this point. On top of that they do not tell you that they charge you for parking in their parking garage. That is another 42 dollars a night. Then the rooms were not anything special and had no extra features. Not even an exhaust fan in the bathroom.

The hotel itself was ok. The bellhop man was ignorant. I had a lot of luggage and they only had two luggage carts. Even after I waited the bellhop man told me others were waiting and I ended making three trips to carry myself up to my room. The check in line was extremely long however the man Michael was pleasant and kind. My room was ok no complaints I loved the shower. But security knocked on my door and accused me of having to many people in my room and that was not true. I had adjourning rooms one for the kids the other for my sister and I Five people in total when the max compasity is 4 per room. Then he had the audacity to say he was coming back to check. I do not appreciate being threatened by hotel security for no good reason. But the nice lady at the coffee cart upgraded our coffees for free. So my all in all my stay was ok. Not the worst but definitely not the best.

Average hotel not as bad as expected. Your experience at this hotel will be just fine as long as you come in with low expectations. At check in I was informed that despite booking a king size room months ago no rooms with king size beds were available in the entire hotel. That is the first time that has happened in my 5 years as a Mariot Starwod platinum member who frequently travels as the room type is guaranteed. Despite this hiccup they were quick to award me a decent number of Starpoints so I was fine with the room with 2 doubles. The room itself is very dated carpet is worn furniture is not in great shape and really just needs a refresh. The bed was comfortable enough but certainly not the best and not as good as the beds at most Courtyards. The rest of the room was functional even though it was worn. The hallway had an odd odor and needs a refresh. The lounge is very small for a hotel of this size but had a decent selection of beverages and snacks when I went. The staff at the hotel did not seem all that attentive but I did n’t have any major problems. Overall the hotel defines average but was far from the nightmare I anticipated when reading some of these reviews. At 200 night for a week when many hotels in Phily were sold out or very expensive you get what you pay for.

Very disappointed. We had issues with this hotel from the minute we waked off the elevator. The hallway smelled like the morning after a fraternity party. We walked into the room and it smelled like marijuana and cigars. I immediately called to the service desk and they said they would send someone up. No one came and I was told there were no rooms available for us to move into I went downstairs and spoke to the concierge who was amazing and he was able to get someone on the phone who said they would come up. Finally at 9 pm someone came with an oxidizer but we had to leave the room from 9 10 pm. When we returned at 10 it was no better. I called 4 times to the front desk and no one picked up. I finally gave up and went to bed. We woke the next morning with headaches and swollen eyes. I went to the front desk and they were able to move us after 120 to a different room. The second room was better but had a funky smell just not nearly as bad as the first. The high speed wifi was terrible and kicked us off every 10 minutes. Definitely not worth the 200. The service staff was extremely friendly but I do n’t think that this hotel is capable of holding an event like this. They were clearly in over their heads.
pictures are much nicer than what the rooms are in person.

Just OK. Overall my experience was good. However certain things I did nt like was the loud door on the room when they closed. Also I did nt like the fact that the only parking offered is paid parking or valet. The room was not very visitor friendly. They was no guide in the room no neighboring information about things to do or eat in the hotel or around. Lastly I loved that I had a room at the end of the hall but my neighbors were just planned loud. I wanted to relax before catching my show but it was hard to do. Overall it was an OK stay and I would stay there again of need be.

At check in we were told a room may not be available for us until 12 hour past their advertised check in time which is not early to start with. The clerk said he would call when the room became available. Half hour past the time and no call. We waited in line with about 30 other people who appeared to be in the same situation. When we got to the counter the clerk indicated our room still was not available. We complained and a manager got involved and we were begrudgingly booked into another room. One of the towels in our room was badly frayed. This Sheraton was the most expensive lodging of our trip by a lot but it was a big disappointment.
I know the Fitness center is under renovation but the equipment was dirty and the room with the cardiovascular equipment was too hot.

Great location modern hotel but there ’s is still some improving to do. Our room did n’t have a fridge but we were offered one very ugly one. Just tossed in the walkway between the bed and the wall. No dresser.

Highly recommend. Location is perfect. Service was amazing. Great food in the Cafe inside. Room was more than spacious and fairly clean. Only 2 complaints little dusty in spots in room and behind the bed head board was dirty with cob webs. Second I would have loved to have a small fridge in the room for beverages and snacks. Overall great experience though. Next time I am in Phily I will be looking for a room from here again. Thanks so much.

Very Poor. nothing. Terrible experience i booked the room thinking it was the newly renovated room which i found out it was the same price. i booked the room 2 weeks in advance had to put down a 105 deposit. when i got into the room there was this foul smell it did not look like the room i booked online and also when i first walked in the hallway light in the room did not work. then after i used the toilet the bowl was all scraped up and not completely clean used the sink to wash my hands and the cold sink handle was broken it keeps leaking. Then an hour or so later after we went to eat dinner i took a shower and the tub would not drain so there was a whole tub full of water so i had to rush my shower. just to add into it the wifi did not work in my room also. so i sat on the phone with technical support for 30 minutes with no results. i am not the type of person to complain but too many things added up for me to have to go speak to the manager and all she had to say was “ that s what you paid for ill send maintenance up ” and also she ’d take 25 off the room. so on my engagement weekend when all i wanted to do was spend time with my fiancé in the room i have to go elsewhere to wait for maintenance to fix it. they could nt even move me into a new room in the mean time. terrible terrible service i will never come here again.
Hotel was in a good location and overall stay was good. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Refrigerator needed in room my spouse thinks bed too low and pillows uncomfortable.

My wife and I attend the phily car show black tie gala every year. Last year we stayed at the Ritz Carlton. We were not impressed. This year the gala landed on our 21st wedding anniversary. So i decided to go back to where we got married. It was the Sheraton back then. When I made the reservation with Mary at concierge. I mentioned it was our anniversary. When we got to our room it was balloons chocolates and a bottle of champagne on ice in our room. Also a card that all staff had signed to congratulate us. I just got major husband points for that. Mary and Ms Householder went way above the call of duty to make our anniversary one to remember. From the valet to the desk clerks everyone was friendly professional and made sure all our needs were met. The room was excellent. The bathroom as well. We will definitely be back. I strongly recommend to any out of towners or phily residents if you want great service and excellent rooms stay at the Philadelphia 201 Hotel for sure.

No Hot Water. I recommend booking literally any other hotel in all of Phily. Perhaps the only saving grace was a nice view from my room. The rooms are mediocre cleanliness is subpar the food was horrendous and the icing on the cake was that they ran out of hot water 2 days in a row here for a 3rd night so it will probably run out again in the morning. As in cold shower in the morning during peak hours. I called the front desk and they did n’t even apologize and nor did the manager call me back as per my request. Absolutely ridiculous. Be better Bonvoy.

Not impressed. We were not impressed. We were not impressed. Walls are paper thin. Could hear full blown conversations of the couple in the room next to us amongst other things. I had to call security in the middle of the night because we could not sleep due to how loud our neighbors were. There was NO hot water both times we took a shower and the the bed was uncomfortable. When I tried to address my concerns with management they simply ignored them and said okay well comp your parking and that was it. The manager could have cared less.
The only thing that I would request would be to have a refrigerator in my room. Other than that my stay was excellent.
It was freezing in Phily and we had the heat in our room up to 80 degrees. Sometimes the room would be warm and sometimes they would n’t but the hotel is under renovations.
